description: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of permutations of {1,2,...,n} having k increasing cycles of length >=2 (0<=k<= n/2). A cycle (b(1), b(2), ...) is said to be increasing if, when written with its smallest element in the first position, it satisfies b(1) < b(2) < b(3) < ... .
